attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: Maximum number of characters per line

attributes.name: dirname
attributes.description: Name of form control to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Maximum length of value

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: Minimum length of value

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use for form submission and in the form.elements API

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: User-visible label to be placed within the form control

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether to allow the value to be edited by the user

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the control is required for form submission

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: Number of lines to show

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description: How the value of the form control is to be wrapped for form submission

attributes.name: accesskey
attributes.description: Provides a hint for generating a keyboard shortcut for the current element

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Indicates that an element should be focused on page load, or when the <dialog> that it is part of is displayed

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: A space-separated list of the case-sensitive classes of the element

attributes.name: contenteditable
attributes.description: Indicates if the element should be editable by the user

attributes.name: dir
attributes.description: Indicates the directionality of the element's text

attributes.name: draggable
attributes.description: Indicates whether the element can be dragged, either with native browser behavior or the HTML Drag and Drop API.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: Defines what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards

attributes.name: exportparts
attributes.description: The exportparts global attribute allows you to select and style elements existing in nested shadow trees, by exporting their part names

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Indicates that the browser should not render the contents of the element

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Defines an identifier (ID) which must be unique in the whole document

attributes.name: inert
attributes.description: indicating that the browser will ignore the element

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents

attributes.name: is
attributes.description: allows you to specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element

attributes.name: itemid
attributes.description: The itemid global attribute provides microdata in the form of a unique, global identifier of an item

attributes.name: itemprop
attributes.description: The itemprop global attribute is used to add properties to an item

attributes.name: itemref
attributes.description: Properties that are not descendants of an element with the itemscope attribute can be associated with an item using the global attribute itemref

attributes.name: itemscope
attributes.description: itemscope is a boolean global attribute that defines the scope of associated metadata

attributes.name: itemtype
attributes.description: The global attribute itemtype specifies the URL of the vocabulary that will be used to define itemprop's (item properties) in the data structure

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: The lang global attribute helps define the language of an element: the language that non-editable elements are written in, or the language that the editable elements should be written in by the user

attributes.name: nonce
attributes.description: The nonce global attribute is a content attribute defining a cryptographic nonce ("number used once") which can be used by Content Security Policy to determine whether or not a given fetch will be allowed to proceed for a given element

attributes.name: part
attributes.description: The part global attribute contains a space-separated list of the part names of the element

attributes.name: slot
attributes.description: The slot global attribute assigns a slot in a shadow DOM shadow tree to an element: An element with a slot attribute is assigned to the slot created by the <slot> element whose name attribute's value matches that slot attribute's value

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: The spellcheck global attribute is an enumerated attribute that defines whether the element may be checked for spelling errors

attributes.name: style
attributes.description: The style global attribute contains CSS styling declarations to be applied to the element

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: The tabindex global attribute allows developers to make HTML elements focusable, allow or prevent them from being sequentially focusable (usually with the Tab key, hence the name) and determine their relative ordering for sequential focus navigation

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title global attribute contains text representing advisory information related to the element it belongs to

attributes.name: translate
attributes.description: The translate global attribute is an enumerated attribute that is used to specify whether an element's translatable attribute values and its Text node children should be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged
